title: 108_s1582
content:
The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 may be cited as the "Valles Caldera Preservation Act." Amendments to the Act are outlined in Section 2. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow the acquisition of mineral interests with available funds, and if negotiations fail, the Secretary can acquire the interests through a declaration of taking. The Secretary is authorized to acquire interests under section 3114 of title 40, United States Code, with any difference in compensation paid from the permanent judgment appropriation. The Trust determines obligations and expenditures, following applicable laws, and solicits donations under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Trust determines obligations and expenditures, and solicits donations under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. Amendments include the manner of incurring expenditures and allowing payments, the solicitation of donations by specified members, and the use of proceeds from claims or settlements after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act (U.S.C. 698v-5(e)) is amended to include provisions for the selection and compensation of the chair of the Board of Trustees, with a maximum compensation limit not to exceed 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act now includes provisions for selecting and compensating the chair of the Board of Trustees, with a maximum pay limit of 25% of the annual rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. (a) Property Disposal Limitations amended to include exclusions for real property disposal, excluding forage, forest products, or marketable renewable resources. 
(b) Law Enforcement and Fire Management section amended for better clarity and organization. (b) Law Enforcement and Fire Management section of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to improve clarity and organization. The amendments include provisions for law enforcement and fire management, with specific details on fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include provisions for law enforcement, fire management, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve. The plan must be consistent with the management program and may be carried out under a cooperative agreement with the Trust. Reimbursable presuppression and nonemergency services may also be provided by the Secretary on a reimbursable basis. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act was passed by the Senate on September 15, 2004.
